articles.title: Olympic champion Sydney McLaughlin breaks her own world record in 400m hurdles
articles.description: Olympic champion Sydney McLaughlin beat her own world record on Saturday capturing the 400-meter hurdles title at the U.S. outdoor track and field championships.
articles.content:
EUGENE, Ore. -- Olympic champion Sydney McLaughlin bested her own world record in the 400-meter hurdles at the U.S. outdoor track and field championships Saturday.

articles.description: In Gee Chun shot a 3-over 75 on Saturday, and saw her 6-shot lead shrink to three strokes heading into the final round of the Women's PGA Championship.
articles.content:
BETHESDA, Md. -- In Gee Chun shot a 3-over 75 on Saturday to take a three-stroke lead into the final round of the Women's PGA Championship.

articles.title: Cristian Javier, Houston Astros bullpen combine for no-hitter vs. New York Yankees
articles.description: Astros pitcher Cristian Javier had a career-high 13 strikeouts through seven innings and combined with two relievers to no-hit the New York Yankees in their own stadium for just the sixth time ever.
articles.content: Houston Astros pitcher Cristian Javier and two relievers combined for the first no-hitter against the New York Yankees in 19 years, shutting down the best team in baseball for a 3-0 victory at Yankee… [+5412 chars]

articles.title: Madison Keys, Borna Coric withdraw from Wimbledon citing injuries
articles.description: Madison Keys has withdrawn from the women's draw at Wimbledon due to an injury as has Borna Coric on the men's side with play set to begin Monday at the AELTC.
articles.content:
WIMBLEDON, England -- Madison Keys, the 2017 U.S. Open runner-up, and Borna Coric withdrew from Wimbledon on Saturday because of injuries.

articles.title: Phoenix Mercury, former WNBA MVP Tina Charles part after 18 games
articles.description: The Mercury have parted with former WNBA MVP Tina Charles. Charles, the league's leading scorer last season, joined Phoenix in February and was averaging 17.3 points and 7.3 rebounds.
articles.content:
Former MVP Tina Charles and the Phoenix Mercury have parted ways in a surprising development for last season's WNBA runner-up team.
